Posted By: InfernoTowel (2/7/2010 8:13:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great tempo in MBC with this guy:  
  
Turn 1: [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress)  
Turn 2: [Smother](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smother)/[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade), [Sign in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign in Blood), maybe [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) (almost never though),  
Turn 3: [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk), [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) kicked or [Fleshbag Marauder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleshbag Marauder)  
Turn 4: [Abyssal Persecutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abyssal Persecutor) or [Tendrils of Corruption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tendrils of Corruption)  
Turn 5: [Mind Sludge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Sludge) or [Bloodwitch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodwitch)  
  
You'll likely draw into into another Gatekeeper or Fleshbag, or even a Tendrils before you need to sac the Persecutor. Sign in Blood is especially helpful here. I've managed to put two Persecutors out one after the other with no concern, managed to remove both of them with two Gatekeepers when the guy was at -8.  
  
Persecutor really makes MBC competitive. Baneslayer has to deal with plenty of removal and a Malakir Bloodwitch in sideboar... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Great tempo in MBC with this guy:

Turn 1: Duress
Turn 2: Smother/Doom Blade, Sign in Blood, maybe Gatekeeper of Malakir (almost never though),
Turn 3: Vampire Nighthawk, Gatekeeper of Malakir kicked or Fleshbag Marauder
Turn 4: Abyssal Persecutor or Tendrils of Corruption
Turn 5: Mind Sludge or Bloodwitch

You'll likely draw into into another Gatekeeper or Fleshbag, or even a Tendrils before you need to sac the Persecutor. Sign in Blood is especially helpful here. I've managed to put two Persecutors out one after the other with no concern, managed to remove both of them with two Gatekeepers when the guy was at -8.

Persecutor really makes MBC competitive. Baneslayer has to deal with plenty of removal and a Malakir Bloodwitch in sideboar... (see all)

Posted By: thezanet (2/8/2010 4:41:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I think this could be interestin in a red and black deck with [bazaar trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bazaar trader) using the demon body at first and then later game switching the effect with your opponnent. I think that one thing people haven`t mentioned about the remove card strategy is that your opponent might counter your own attempts to destroy your own card. This could be a serious problem. I also wonder whether this cards effects would overule [platinum angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=platinum angel) or exactly how the wizards are gonna handle that one. It might be interesting to have them make the trumping effect based on which card entered play first.

posts.post_content: Jesus Christ! Why is everyone going apeshit about this guy like he's the friggin' black Tarmogoyf?! Seriously, people, calm down! He costs 4 mana, which means you likely won't have mana at the ready to respond to opponent's removal the same turn you play him, you need to kill him yourself to even regain the ability of winning the game, and everything except Doom Blade kills him on the spot. Oh, and Baneslayer laughs at him. Look, I'm not saying it's a bad card. He's good, but definitely NOT 28-bucks-good!
posts.html:

posts.post_content: now THIS is what a mythic should be like...plenty of options, one that you actually have to think about before you use it...not like baneslayer. baneslayer was just overpowered. like how plat angel might give you a false sense of security, this guy's effect usually makes your opponent unwilling to kill it, so you can just blow ur opponent to 0 life and destroy it...and its not very hard to do that with a 6/6 flying trample body...
